cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic and 70 miles SE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest through the Bahamas, then bending northwest toward the Florida peninsula and inland across the southeast United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida peninsula (near the Florida Keys / Everglades area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch presently posted only from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: None north of Jupiter Inlet at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and portions of South Carolina northward to North Carolina are within the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are increasingly likely (60% chance) with a 1-in-4 chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NE Florida coast, including the St. Johns River estuary, could see 3–5 ft of surge if Irma tracks just inland as projected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 6–10 inches of rain with higher local totals, producing urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands.
